entry.title: Merge avoidance and P2P connection encryption
entry.summary: In a recent article, the author discusses Bitcoin privacy topics aimed at a non-developer audience. The article covers P2P connection encryption, address re-use/payment protocol, and CoinJoin and merge avoidance. While the topics may not be new for those involved in BIP70 design discussions, the article can serve as a useful resource when discussing privacy features in the payment protocol. The article goes into detail about how to utilize the ability to request multiple outputs and submit multiple transactions to achieve better privacy outcomes.Additionally, the author analyzes the use of SSL for P2P connections and its potential benefits and limitations. The article provides insights into the importance of privacy in Bitcoin transactions and highlights various methods for improving it. For readers looking to better understand Bitcoin privacy, the article serves as an informative and educational resource. The author's expertise in the subject matter is evident, making the piece a valuable addition to the discussion around Bitcoin privacy. The article can be accessed through the link provided: https://medium.com/p/7f95a386692f.
